kernfrasen: The move from a world of fear to a world of love
Transfer from the world of fear
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: CONVERSION IS A SPATIAL TRANSFER BETWEEN WORLDS

kernfrasen: Dwell in that cottage of fear

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: He dove into the water of baptism. He immersed himself in the good news.

cognitieve_implicaties: Faith is not just mental assent but a full-body environment change.
theologische_implicaties: Baptism is the boundary between two ontological realities (Fear vs. Love).
ethische_implicaties: One cannot be 'partially' in the gospel; it requires total immersion.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests a suddenness that may ignore the 'lifelong work' mentioned later.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'dead' metaphor of baptism by using the visceral language of 'diving' and 'plunging' into a different 'world'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a consistent binary structure: The World of Fear vs. The World of Love. All sub-metaphors (economic, architectural, journey) serve this central spatial dualism.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Fear is treated both as a sentient enemy to be banished and a logical error to be realized.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: One requires power/exorcism; the other requires education/insight.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Cottage of Fear' blends the idea of a lived-in space with the 'cottage industry' of the military-industrial complex, showing how fear is both a home and a business.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'Eunuch' narrative by mapping modern anxieties (Starbucks, National Security State) onto the ancient text.
sterktes.voorbeeld: He was reading the good scroll... not unlike the Bible readers one sees at Starbucks.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing so heavily on the 'Treasury' and 'Money' aspect of the Eunuch, the spiritual dimension risks being reduced to socio-economic critique.
risicos.voorbeeld: A life not defined by money management... being daily sucked into a world of bureaucratic cunning.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view salvation primarily as political/economic liberation rather than ontological change.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Chariot in the Gaza Strip (a space of transition).

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in creating a sense of shared 'schema' between the biblical character and the hearer.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeatedly contrasted against the 'Fear' schema of the state.

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: The Eunuch as a 'dry tree' or minor character
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: The Eunuch as a high-level executive/bureaucrat facing modern burnout.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the Easter theme of 'New Life' and 'Passing over' from death to life.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by spatial and movement metaphors (Diving, Moving, Casting Out). It successfully uses the Economic domain to describe the 'World of Fear' and the Relational domain to describe the 'World of Love'. The landscape is one of sharp contrastsâ€”a binary geography of the soul.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Bordering on a 'Dead Metaphor' due to over-familiarity.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Lean harder into the 'Excommunication' or 'Banishment' imagery mentioned in Section VII.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Fear is a squatter in the house of your heart; Love is the rightful owner serving an eviction notice.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Connect them: The water of baptism 'displaces' the fear, like pouring water into a glass of air.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Diving is a one-time act; faith is a 'lifelong work'.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Use 'Learning to swim' as a follow-up metaphor to bridge the gap between the event and the process.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To address the 'contagion' of fear mentioned in the text.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: Sanctification as an immune response to the virus of fear.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to bridge the ancient text and contemporary political/psychological reality. The 'World of Fear' vs 'World of Love' mapping is cognitively sticky and homiletically powerful.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'chariot of privilege' phrasing, CMT reveals that this phrase functions to map social status onto a physical container that isolates the Eunuch.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning cycles, CMT shows that the 'experience' of the sermon is constructed through the mapping of the 'Fear' schema onto the 'Economic' source domain.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is not just telling a story, but performing a 'Deictic Shift' that forces the hearer to inhabit the Eunuch's 'Text World' as their own.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Sucked into a world of bureaucratic cunning
Culture of fear is a fraud
appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'Fear' and 'Love' as containers/worlds rather than just emotions.
